item.title: The pedestrian / cycle traffic light button has been vandalised., 2nd July
item.description:
The pedestrian / cycle traffic light button has been vandalised. It is permanently stuck down. This is causing the vehicular traffic lights to stay on red when no pedestrians or cyclists are there. Causing long tail backs.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: The traffic light has been vandalised

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Very large A Board on highway approx a foot into the road in area of DYL. Belongs to TAVERN pub. Put in road every evening, 2nd July

Approx a foot into the road in area of DYL. Belongs to TAVERN pub. Put in road every evening. Refuses to move it. VERY large A Board could injure a vehicle, pedestrian/child etc
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Royal Well Place, Montpellier, Cheltenham

item.title: Light Timing Incorrect, 2nd July
item.description:
The timing of these lights have either been changed or have gone out of sync as of wc 01/07/2025 traveling in the direction of chelt or glos the lights only let 4 to 5 cars over before going red to allow traffic from commerce road or the opp industrial estate out however no cars appear from here nor are either of the predestination crossing buttons pressed. this is causing large tail backs of traffic to past banfurlong lane and also to past the down hatherly junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Traffic light head is facing wrong direction

item.title: Fly tipping, 2nd July
item.description:
An assortment of black bags and plastic pots dumped on the pavement on corner of Thornbury Close and Alstone Avenue. They have been there for weeks.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Alstone Avenue, Alstone, Cheltenham

item.title: Fly tipping, 2nd July

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Pates Avenue, Alstone, Cheltenham

item.title: Traffic Light timings out causing massive traffic build up., 2nd July
item.description:
Traffic lights along Cheltenham road east opposite the marshalls land rover garage have had their timings changed. They stay green for about 3 seconds before changing again causing traffic build up. Website states there is roadworks in this area. There are none. This is specifically a timing issue. Also says it has been sorted as it has been previously reported. It has not.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole getting more dangerous. Someone is going to injure themselves if they trip, 1st July
item.description:
Where the pavement meets the boundary of 147 Arle Road it has lots of loose stones which are slowly moving out making the hole deeper and more dangerous

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 147, Arle Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sharp brambles at face/eye level full width on path, 1st July
item.description:
Can't use the path without spikey brambles to face/eyes, so on a blind corner find yourself walking/running into oncoming cyclists who have no visibility around the corner. 20m around the corner to the west the path and hedges have been cleared to a high standard, the corner where the cycle path stops (but the cyclists continue obviously) is in a major need of cutback to allow safe use of the path

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Hedge / vegetation blocking access or obstructing the footpath or cycle path

item.title: Path once again ploughed in and cropped over., 1st July
item.description:
The path from Woolstone Hill Farm (SO 96793 30312) towards Dixton (SO 97687 30659) has been ploughed in. In two of the fields there is no crop and so no impediment to progress, although the line of path is not clear. In one field there is wheat and another maize. This path is routinely ploughed over and no effort is made to reinstate. This is the line of the Gloucestershire Way.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gretton Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Grass has grown long and has not been mown to delineate path. Electric fences blocking one of right of way, 1st July
item.description:
As above
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harnham Lane, Cotswold
